page.title: 01Background to survey area.
page.content: The area surveyed by first year pupils from Cleeve school (a mixed comprehensive of 1350 pupils)is 6 kilometres to the north of Cheltenham.The area has no large settlement within it but does include parts of the following villages: Bishops Cleeve, Stoke Orchard, Gotherington, and Woolstone. With the exception of Woolstone, all the other villages have shown a considerable increase in their populations in recent years. The area lies immediately to the west of the Cotswold Hills and marks the division between the Severn valley and the steep scarp slope of the Cotswolds. The land lies between 30 and 60 metres above sea level.The settlements which mark the eastern part of the area are spring line settlements.
